College: Dr Vithalrao Vikhe Patil Foundation’s College of Pharmacy, Ahmednagar
Approval: (PCI) Pharmacy Council of India
Eligiblity:
In order to secure admission through CAP to First Year of four year Degree Course in Pharmacy, the candidate should fulfill the following eligibility criteria:
1. Passed the HSC (Std. XII) examination of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education or its equivalent examination with
– English as one of the subjects.
– All the subjects mentioned under Group-I, &
– Any one of the subjects from Group-II.
AND
2. Secured minimum 50% marks (45% for backward class candidates from Maharashtra) in Physics, Chemistry and the subject of maximum marks amongst the subjects of Group-II, added together.
Course_Detail:
A four year full time professional course with the objective of imparting technical pharmacy knowledge to science students is strictly carried out as per the norms and syllabus framed by university of Pune.
The course of study in each subject would extend over to period of at least 25 weeks in a year excluding days spent in examination

College: Dr Vithalrao Vikhe Patil Foundation’s College of Pharmacy, Ahmednagar
Approval: (PCI) Pharmacy Council of India

The eligibility for admission to M. Pharm course is as under:
The candidate who has passed the examination for the degree of B. Pharm of University of Pune or any other statutory University, recognized as equivalent thereto by this university, with at least 60% marks will be eligible for admission to one of the specializations of pharmacy mentioned above.
The post graduate student in the faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences will not be permitted to register his/her name simultaneously for Diploma or degree Course of University of Pune or any other College / Institution.
Course_Detail: The college offers Master of Pharmacy (M. Pharm.) course of two years (four semesters)

College: MS Ramaiah College of Pharmacy, Bangalore
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
Candidates who have passed two year P.U.C examination of Karnataka P.U.C board or an equivalent examination of any other approved board or University with not less than 50% marks in any combination comprising P.C.M or P.C.B or P.C.M.B, P.C and Computer science, PC and electronics.
In case of students belonging to SC/ST or Category-I, the minimum percentage of marks for admission to B.Pharm course shall not be less than 40% P.U.C or its equivalent examination (PCB, PCM, PCMB), P.C and Computer science, PC and electronics.
Candidates who have scored less than 50% marks in (10+2) but who have completed B.Sc degree with Chemistry as one of the compulsory subjects in combination with any two of the following subjects namely Physics or mathematics or Microbiology or Botany or Bio- technology or computer sciences or Electronics securing not less than 50% marks in aggregate are eligible for admission to first year B.Pharm course.
Candidates who have scored less than 50% marks in 10+2 but who have completed D.Pharm course securing more than 50% marks in aggregate in D.Pharm are eligible to be admitted to I B.Pharm course
Candidates who have passed D.Pharm course with not less than 50% aggregate approved by Pharmacy Council of India Shall also be eligible to this course and shall be admitted directly to II B.Pharm course 10% over and above the sanctioned intake and shall have to study Mathematics, Computer Science and Statistics of I B.Pharm in addition to the II B.Pharm subjects.
Course_Detail: Bachelors of Pharmacy is full time four year course degree offered by Rajiv Gandhi University of Health Sciences, Bangalore and approved by AICTE.

For CET students
Candidates should have passed in Diploma in Pharmacy examination from an Institution approved by the Pharmacy Council of India under section 12 of the Pharmacy Act and has secured minimum of 45% marks in final year Diploma in Pharmacy for General Merit (40% for SC/ST Category-I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B candidates). Merit will be determined on the basis of performance of the candidates in Physics, Chemistry and Biology subjects or Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics subjects i.e, PCB or PCM marks whichever is highest in the Common Entrance Test 2014. Rank list will be prepared and published for admission to 2nd Year B-Pharma (Lateral Entry).
Candidates who have passed Diploma in Pharmacy course seeking admission to 2nd year B-Pharma (Lateral Entry) should compulsorily submit their photocopy of D.pharm (Final year) marks card on which CET number boldly written to KEA . Failing which Rank will not be assigned to the candidate."

College: Karpagam College of Pharmacy, Mayileripalayam
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity:
1. No candidate shall be allowed to be admitted to the B.Pharmacy degree course until he/she has completed the age of 17 years on or before the 31st December of the academic year in which the candidate is seeking admission.
2. Candidates belonging to all categories except Scheduled Caste/ Scheduled Tribes for admission to the B. Pharmacy course must have obtained individual pass marks in Physics, Chemistry & Biology or Botany & Zoology or Mathematics both in theory and practical with a minimum of 35% marks. Not less than 40% aggregate marks in the above subjects is mandatory at the qualifying examination (Academic Stream) after a period of 12 years of study i.e.10+2 pattern of education.
3. Candidates belonging to Scheduled Castes/ Scheduled Tribes must have obtained individual pass marks in Physics, Chemistry, Biology or Botany & Zoology or Mathematics both in theory and practical with a minimum of 35% marks and not less than 35% aggregate marks in the above subjects.
4. A pass in English with a minimum of 35% marks is mandatory for all categories for admission to the course.
5. Candidates who have passed the Senior Secondary School Examination of National open School with a minimum of 5 subjects with any of the following :
group subjects:
a) English, Physics, Chemistry, Botany, Zoology.
b) English, Physics, Chemistry, Biology and any other language.
Course_Detail: Bachelor of Pharmacy is four-years duration full-time course affiliated to Tamil Nadu Dr. MGR Medical University, Chennai and approved by All India Council of Technical Education & Pharmacy Council of India.
